page.title: 16STEETON TRAFFIC CENSUS:2
page.content: A record was made of the cargoes the lorries carried these fell into several categories,food (meat, cakes, frozen products,fruit), building materials (windows, wood, cement, timber, paint), machine parts,wool for textiles and livestock (cattle,sheep, poultry). Most of the lorries had travelled from the industrial areas of West and South Yorkshire. Apart from the volume of traffic the noise and air pollution was considerable causing discomfort to the survey teams on both sides of the road. Due to the large number of vehicles on this road tail backs of up to 1 mile can occur.The A65 is a major road which requires careful replanning to ensure a smooth traffic flow in the future.
